message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.IR 

This paper is about relation extraction, which is a subfield of natural language processing (NLP). The paper proposes a method that combines traditional feature-based methods with convolutional and recurrent neural networks to improve relation extraction. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which is focused on NLP and its intersection with computer science. 

The paper also discusses the effectiveness of different network architectures and combination methods, which suggests that it could be relevant to sub-categories such as cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). 

Finally, the paper evaluates its approach on two datasets, which suggests that it could also be relevant to cs.IR (Information Retrieval), which often involves evaluating the effectiveness of methods on specific datasets.
